DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Confirmed Diagnosis Gynecologic Oncology Group Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to established or verified identification by signs and symptoms of malignant tumor spread from an original (primary) site to another location in the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to established or verified identification by signs and symptoms of malignant tumor spread from an original (primary) site to another location in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Metastatic Neoplasm Confirmed Diagnosis Gynecologic Oncology Group Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator for metastatic confirmation use for the Gynecologic Oncology Group (GOG) is a non-profit NCI-supported organization headquartered in Philadelphia, PA.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, mets not restricted to nodes
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes, mets not restricted to nodes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes, mets not restricted to nodes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yes, mets not restricted to nodes

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The Gynecologic Oncology Group (GOG) is a non-profit NCI-supported organization headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, with the purpose of promoting excellence in the quality and integrity of clinical and basic scientific research in the field of gynecologic malignancies. Approximately 45 individual clinical trials are active at any one time within GOG.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: A non-profit NCI-supported organization with the purpose of promoting excellence in the quality and integrity of clinical and basic scientific research in the field of gynecologic malignancies. Approximately 45 individual clinical trials are active at any one time within GOG.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the CT scan or MRI demons
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the CT scan or MRI demonstrate evidence suggestive of metastatic disease (adnexa, nodes, intraperitoneal)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a CT or MRI (abdomen or pelvis) and either chest X-Ray or CT chest demonstrating no evidence of disease outside of the uterus?  (Imaging can be performed pre-operatively or post-operatively)

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
